page.title: 02TILSTONE FEARNALL SCHOOL
page.content: { Tilstone Fearnall School}was built in 1836 by{John Tollemache M.P}(the first Lord Tollemache) for the children of his estate workers. Today the School serves a rural area with the children coming from several small villages in the area -{Tiverton, {Alpraham,Beeston,Peckforton}and, of course Tilstone Fearnall.The children from Peckforton,Beeston and Tiverton are conveyed to school by special bus. The old Log books report that there were once 220 children in the school but in recent times the highest number has been 132, while at the present moment it is only 31. The teaching staff is a Head,a deputy head and an assistant teacher. The midday meal (costing 70p) is brought in from Chester.Four children are entitled to a Free Meal,but most of the children bring their own lunch.
